alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 5:54AM CST until February 28 at 11:08PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Agricultural land and other areas near the river are extensively flooded from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. Flood waters approach roads near the river, including Hurricane Mills Rd, Old Hwy 13 between Cedar Grove and Forks of the River Rd, Forks of the River Rd between Blue Creek Rd, Pumpkin Creek Rd, and near the Link Farm State Archaeological Area, Dyer Rd, and Tumbling Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 23.4 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CST Sunday was 24.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 12.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.5 feet on 05/07/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM CST.
